region.core: Trunk region; deficits present as trunk force, control, or endurance limits.
region.back: Posterior trunk region; deficits present as spinal extensor force, control, or tolerance limits.
region.hip: Hip region; deficits present as hip force production or femoral control limits.
region.knee: Knee region; deficits present as knee force control or tolerance limits.
region.ankle: Ankle region; deficits present as distal control, force, or balance limits.
region.foot: Foot region; deficits present as intrinsic or toe-related control or force limits.
region.shoulder: Shoulder girdle; deficits present as scapular or glenohumeral control or force limits.
region.vestibular: Vestibular system contribution; deficits present as impaired gaze stability, balance integration, or motion tolerance.

capacity.strength: Ability to generate force. Failure looks like inability to hold, lift, or resist load.
capacity.control: Ability to maintain alignment while joints move. Failure looks like loss of alignment, sequencing, or timing.
capacity.stability: Ability to maintain position under asymmetry, perturbation, or unstable support. Failure looks like wobble, loss of balance, or giving way.
capacity.tolerance: Ability to sustain effort or posture over time. Failure looks like fatigue or symptom onset before form loss.
capacity.mobility: Ability to access and control available range of motion.

contribution.high: This exercise independently builds this capacity.
contribution.medium: This exercise meaningfully contributes but is not sufficient alone.
contribution.low: This exercise supports or touches this capacity.
